meanings.sent1: The hypaethral courtyard allowed the sunlight to filter through freely.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins had a hypaethral design, with no roof to shield from the elements.
meanings.sent3: The hypaethral garden was perfect for stargazing on clear nights.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a hypaethral room, open and exposed to all ideas.
meanings.sent5: The hypaethral field stretched out endlessly, under the vast blue sky.

meanings.definition: A building or part of a building that is open to the sky.
meanings.sent1: The temple's hypaethral structure was a unique feature of ancient architecture.
meanings.sent2: The hypaethral section of the museum was dedicated to sculptures and statues.
meanings.sent3: The hypaethral atrium was a popular spot for bird-watching enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a hypaethral building, with thoughts coming and going freely.
meanings.sent5: The hypaethral amphitheater provided a breathtaking view of the stars at night.
